alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 1:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 145 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Santa Rosa Lake State Park, or 9 miles north of Santa Rosa, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Santa Rosa Lake State Park and Cuervo. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 269 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Boaters should move to safe shelter now! Persons in campgrounds should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County
